Haywood began the convention with the following speech:{{ref|zinn2}}

<blockquote>Fellow Workers, this is the [[Continental Congress]] of the working-class. We are here to confederate the workers of this country into a working-class movement that shall have for its purpose the emancipation of the working-class from the slave bondage of capitalism. The aims and objects of this organization shall be to put the working-class in possession of the economic power, the means of life, in control of the machinery of production and distribution, without regard to capitalist masters.</blockquote>
Other speakers at the convention included [[Eugene Debs]], leader of the [[Socialist Party of America]], and [[Mary Jones|Mother Mary Jones]], an organizer for the [[United Mine Workers of America]].{{ref|zinn3}} After it's foundation, the IWW would become aggressively involved in the labor movement.
